meanings.sent1: She is misbiassing the results by only considering one side of the argument.
meanings.sent2: He misbiasses the information by always favoring his own opinions.
meanings.sent3: The detective misbiassing the evidence to frame the wrong suspect would make a great plot twist.
meanings.sent4: Her misbiassing of the facts painted a distorted picture of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The politician's misbiassing of statistics was so blatant that even children could see through it.

meanings.definition: Misbiassing: Third person singular present of misbias.
meanings.sent1: He often misbiasses the data to fit his preconceived notions.
meanings.sent2: The company misbiasses their findings to make their product seem superior.
meanings.sent3: The robot misbiassing its programming to prioritize fun over work would be quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The storm misbiasses the landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The artist misbiassing the colors in the painting created a surreal effect.
